def pointwiseConverges {S : Type u} (f : S ) (g : S ) : Prop := x, Tendsto (fun n => f n x) atTop ( (g x))

Proposition 6.1.5: A sequence of functions converges pointwise to if and only if for every Unknown identifier `x`sorry sorry : Propx Unknown identifier `S`S and every Unknown identifier ``sorry > 0 : Prop > 0 there exists Unknown identifier `N`N such that |sorry - sorry| < sorry : Prop|Unknown identifier `f`f x - Unknown identifier `f`f x| < Unknown identifier `` for all Unknown identifier `n`sorry sorry : Propn Unknown identifier `N`N.

Definition 6.1.6: A sequence of functions converges uniformly to if for every Unknown identifier ``sorry > 0 : Prop > 0 there exists Unknown identifier `N`N such that for all Unknown identifier `n`sorry sorry : Propn Unknown identifier `N`N and all Unknown identifier `x`sorry sorry : Propx Unknown identifier `S`S, we have |sorry - sorry| < sorry : Prop|Unknown identifier `f`f x - Unknown identifier `f`f x| < Unknown identifier ``.

def uniformConverges {S : Type u} (f : S ) (g : S ) : Prop := > (0 : ), N : , n N, x : S, |f n x - g x| <

Proposition 6.1.7: If a sequence of functions converges uniformly to , then it converges pointwise to Unknown identifier `f`f.

Definition 6.1.9: For a bounded function , the uniform norm is the supremum of the absolute value of Unknown identifier `f`f over the set Unknown identifier `S`S; this coincides with the usual sup (or infinity) norm.

noncomputable def uniformNormOn {S : Type u} (A : Set S) (f : S ) : := sSup ((fun x => |f x|) '' A)

Proposition 6.1.10: A sequence of bounded functions converges uniformly to if and only if the uniform norms of the difference Unknown identifier `f`sorry - sorry : ?m.5f - Unknown identifier `f`f converge to 0 : 0.

Definition 6.1.12: A sequence of bounded functions is uniformly Cauchy (Cauchy in the uniform norm) if for every Unknown identifier ``sorry > 0 : Prop > 0 there exists Unknown identifier `N`N such that for all , the uniform norm of Unknown identifier `f`sorry - sorry : ?m.5f - Unknown identifier `f`f on Unknown identifier `S`S is less than Unknown identifier ``.

def uniformlyCauchy {S : Type u} (f : S ) : Prop := > (0 : ), N : , m N, k N, uniformNormOn (Set.univ : Set S) (fun x => f m x - f k x) <

Proposition 6.1.13: For bounded functions , the sequence is uniformly Cauchy (Cauchy in the uniform norm) if and only if there exists a function such that Unknown identifier `f`f converges uniformly to Unknown identifier `f`f.

theorem uniformlyCauchy_iff_exists_uniformLimit {S : Type u} (f : S ) (hbounded : n, BddAbove ((fun x => |f n x|) '' (Set.univ : Set S))) : uniformlyCauchy f g : S , uniformConverges f g := by classical constructor intro hC have bddAbove_abs_sub_univ : m k, BddAbove ((fun x => |f m x - f k x|) '' (Set.univ : Set S)) := by intro m k rcases hbounded m with Mm, hMm rcases hbounded k with Mk, hMk refine Mm + Mk, ?_ intro y hy rcases hy with x, hx, rfl have hm : |f m x| Mm := hMm x, by simp, rfl have hk : |f k x| Mk := hMk x, by simp, rfl have hsum : |f m x - f k x| |f m x| + |f k x| := by simpa using (abs_sub_le (f m x) 0 (f k x)) linarith have abs_sub_le_uniformNormOn_univ : m k x, |f m x - f k x| uniformNormOn (Set.univ : Set S) (fun x => f m x - f k x) := by intro m k x unfold uniformNormOn refine le_csSup (bddAbove_abs_sub_univ m k) ?_ refine x, by simp, rfl have hpoint_cauchy : x, CauchySeq (fun n => f n x) := by intro x refine (Metric.cauchySeq_iff).2 ?_ intro h rcases hC h with N, hN refine N, ?_ intro m hm k hk have hmk' : uniformNormOn (Set.univ : Set S) (fun x => f m x - f k x) < := hN m hm k hk have hle : |f m x - f k x| uniformNormOn (Set.univ : Set S) (fun x => f m x - f k x) := abs_sub_le_uniformNormOn_univ m k x have hlt : |f m x - f k x| < := lt_of_le_of_lt hle hmk' simpa [Real.dist_eq] using hlt have hpoint : x, l, Tendsto (fun n => f n x) atTop ( l) := by intro x exact cauchySeq_tendsto_of_complete (hpoint_cauchy x) choose g hg using hpoint refine g, ?_ intro h have h2 : 0 < / 2 := by linarith rcases hC ( / 2) h2 with N, hN refine N, ?_ intro m hm x have h_event : k in atTop, f k x Metric.closedBall (f m x) ( / 2) := by refine (eventually_atTop.2 ?_) refine N, ?_ intro k hk have hmk' : uniformNormOn (Set.univ : Set S) (fun x => f m x - f k x) < / 2 := hN m hm k hk have hle : |f m x - f k x| uniformNormOn (Set.univ : Set S) (fun x => f m x - f k x) := abs_sub_le_uniformNormOn_univ m k x have hlt : |f m x - f k x| < / 2 := lt_of_le_of_lt hle hmk' have hdist : dist (f k x) (f m x) < / 2 := by have hdist' : dist (f m x) (f k x) < / 2 := by simpa [Real.dist_eq] using hlt simpa [dist_comm] using hdist' have hdist_le : dist (f k x) (f m x) / 2 := le_of_lt hdist simpa [Metric.mem_closedBall] using hdist_le have hxmem : g x Metric.closedBall (f m x) ( / 2) := by have hclosed : IsClosed (Metric.closedBall (f m x) ( / 2)) := Metric.isClosed_closedBall exact hclosed.mem_of_tendsto (hg x) h_event have hdist' : dist (f m x) (g x) / 2 := by have hdist : dist (g x) (f m x) / 2 := by simpa [Metric.mem_closedBall] using hxmem simpa [dist_comm] using hdist have hle : |f m x - g x| / 2 := by simpa [Real.dist_eq] using hdist' have hhalf : / 2 < := by linarith exact lt_of_le_of_lt hle hhalf rintro g, hconv h have h4 : 0 < / 4 := by linarith rcases hconv ( / 4) h4 with N, hN refine N, ?_ intro m hm k hk have hbound : x, |f m x - f k x| < / 2 := by intro x have hm' : |f m x - g x| < / 4 := hN m hm x have hk' : |f k x - g x| < / 4 := hN k hk x have hsum : |f m x - f k x| |f m x - g x| + |f k x - g x| := by simpa [abs_sub_comm] using (abs_sub_le (f m x) (g x) (f k x)) have hsum_lt : |f m x -
